turn.2: But as the domestic credit and debit card markets neared saturation, Verifone changed its primary focus to producing software applications, offering vertically integrated systems solutions, including applications for standard computer operating systems.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: It also built a new plant near Shanghai in China in 1994 to increase production capacity.
turn.5: What were some of the company's major accomplishments?
turn.6: Verifone moved to take the lead in the coming smart card revolution, teaming up with Gemplus International, a France-based maker of the cards, and MasterCard International to form the joint venture "SmartCash".
turn.8: To place the company close to technological developments in France and the rest of Europe, Verifone opened its Paris research and development center in 1994. The company launched its smart card in May 1995.
turn.9: What other products did the company sell?
turn.10: The company introduced its Personal ATM, a palm-sized smart card reader capable of reading a variety of smart card formats, in September 1996, with the product expected to ship in 1997.
turn.11: Did the company have any major customers?
turn.12: Among the first customers already signed to support the P-ATM were American Express, MasterCard International, GTE, Mondex International, Visa International, Wells Fargo Bank, and Sweden's Sparbanken Bank.
